summary: The Department of Energy estimated it will cost $1.4 billion to deactivate and decommission National Nuclear Security Administration facilities that are no longer used and are contaminated with radiological and chemical waste. DOE is required to regularly update its plans for this work. Its last plan didn't have all the required information or all of what's needed to help ensure goals are met. For example...
title: Contaminated Excess Facilities: Use of Key Practices Would Strengthen DOE's Disposition Planning Efforts
